alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford; Edgar; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 12:37AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...HEIGHTENED FIRE DANGER ACROSS SOUTHEAST ILLINOIS TODAY... A WARM AIRMASS WILL SET UP ACROSS THE AREA TODAY. THIS WARMTH COMBINED WITH DEWPOINTS DROPPING TO THE MID TO LOWER 40S DURING THE AFTERNOON WILL PRODUCE LOW AFTERNOON RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES OF 25 TO 30 PERCENT. IN ADDITION...IN A TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENT AHEAD OF LOW PRESSURE TRACKING INTO THE UPPER MIDWEST...SOUTHWEST WINDS OF OF 20 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS WILL BLOW. THESE WEATHER CONDITIONS COMBINED WITH DRY VEGETATION...WILL CREATE CONDITIONS FAVORABLE FOR SPORADIC RAPID FIRE SPREAD. PEOPLE ARE DISCOURAGED FROM OUTDOOR BURNING. IF COOKING OUTDOORS...KEEP A CAREFUL WATCH ON THE GRILL. BURNING EMBERS CAN BLOW AROUND AND EASILY CATCH GRASS ON FIRE. IMPROPERLY DISCARDED CIGARETTES CAN ALSO START FIRES WHICH COULD SPREAD QUICKLY.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Crawford; Edgar; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland
